docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 10 (AP) -- The widening circle of suppressive action against alleged Axis plotting in South America has brought seizure of arms caches and several arrests in the snowcovered region of Puerto Montt, Chile, a principal center of...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 10 (AP) -- The widening circle of suppressive action against alleged Axis plotting in South America has brought seizure of arms caches and several arrests in the snowcovered region of Puerto Montt, Chile, a principal center of German colonization on the continent.

docs.snippet: TO THE EDITOR OF THE NEW YORK TIMES: In your editorial "Markets for Our Neighbors" you inform that "increasing efforts are being made to develop permanent markets in the United States for South American products not hitherto sold here," and you...
docs.lead_paragraph: TO THE EDITOR OF THE NEW YORK TIMES: In your editorial "Markets for Our Neighbors" you inform that "increasing efforts are being made to develop permanent markets in the United States for South American products not hitherto sold here," and you comment that "such efforts deserve every encouragement from the United States."

headline.main: Trade Boards at Work; Inter-American Commissions Are Now Being Developed

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 14 -- While investigation of the anti-Chilean plot charges brought against five leaders of the Nazi movement in Southern Chile were moved to Puerto Rico, the Chamber of Deputies in a special session took up today the bill...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 14 -- While investigation of the anti-Chilean plot charges brought against five leaders of the Nazi movement in Southern Chile were moved to Puerto Rico, the Chamber of Deputies in a special session took up today the bill presented last night by Deputy Julio Barrenechea, a leading Socialist, to stop Nazi-Fascist penetration.
docs.abstract: Deputies study anti-Nazi bill offered by Deputy J Barrenechea; outstanding points

docs.snippet: MRS. MARGARET CULKIN BANNING, some time last Winter, took off enough time from her popular fiction serials to make an airplane trip around South America. Now she has published a haphazard diary of that trip.
docs.lead_paragraph: MRS. MARGARET CULKIN BANNING, some time last Winter, took off enough time from her popular fiction serials to make an airplane trip around South America. Now she has published a haphazard diary of that trip.

headline.main: Margaret Culkin Banning's "Salud!" Is an Informal Travel Journal; SALUD! A South American Journal. By Margaret Culkin Banning. 371 pp. New York: Harper & Brothers. $2.75.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO. THE American car, much too broad for the single-track road of leveled reddish earth, dashed around curves at an absurd speed as it made its way through the jungle-covered hills near the coast in the State of Santa Catharina in...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO. THE American car, much too broad for the single-track road of leveled reddish earth, dashed around curves at an absurd speed as it made its way through the jungle-covered hills near the coast in the State of Santa Catharina in Southern Brazil.
